content:
Diagnosis:		Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumour (NET), non-functional

Management:		15 Jan 2024 Distal pancreatectomy and splenectomy

Histology:		Well-differentiated NET G1, Ki67 2%, R0 resection, pT2N0

Current situation:	Routine surveillance review

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today following surgery for pancreatic NET. She has made an excellent recovery from her operation with no post-operative complications. Her surgical wounds have healed well and she reports no new symptoms. Her appetite and weight are stable. Blood tests including chromogranin A are within normal range. Recent CT scan on 15/4/24 shows no evidence of recurrent or metastatic disease. Her diabetes is well-controlled on metformin. The plan is to continue surveillance with 6-monthly CT imaging and annual chromogranin A measurements. We will review her again in clinic in 6 months with repeat imaging.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Well-differentiated NET G1, Ki67 2%, R0 resection

cancer_timeline.value: CT scan shows no evidence of recurrent or metastatic disease

status_updates.value: Well-differentiated pancreatic NET post successful surgical resection. Excellent post-operative recovery with no evidence of recurrence on surveillance
Excellent recovery from surgery with no post-operative complications
6-monthly CT imaging and annual chromogranin A measurements
Review in clinic in 6 months with repeat imaging
